intro: Saracha lindeniana, commonly known as the Lindena lindeniana, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Saracha lindeniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
